line.en: Road bicycle racing is known as the toughest\nsport.
Among other things, the hill climb is hell too.
While putting strain on every muscle in your\nbody, you have to continue pedaling without any\nbreaks to climb a steep hill.
At that time, I always think
'I can't do this anymore! I'll make this race my\nlast!'
Even though I think that every time, in the end,\nI still take part in the next race.
I've endured severe training so that I don't put\nmy feet down halfway through the hill climb.
Why do I do that?
Because once I finish the hill climb, My reward\nis waiting for me.
Nothing compares to the feeling of cutting\nthrough the wind, as I race down the downhill\nsection at blistering speeds.
At that moment, I feel an incredible rush.
Then, I realize that I have forgotten about\neverything.
The pain of the hill climb, the strain on every\nmuscle in my body, and the days of hard practice.
It's not a matter of whether I win or lose the\nrace.
I just enjoy it, and that's why I continue to\nride.
That's how it should've been...
I still didn't have much experience in life at\nthat time and it was something beyond my\nimagination.
Suddenly, without warning, something was 'taken'\nfrom me.
I could also say 'shut away' or 'lost'.
However, to directly express the emotion I felt\nat that time, 'taken' is the word that fits best.
...So, there was one thing that I learned. Life\nisn't all about having fun!
I learned a lesson in life.
The thing I lost, was everything.
I let myself get depressed about this, but I\nshould've thought about it a little more.
If something could be 'taken' from me so\nabruptly, then something could be 'given' to me\njust as suddenly.
The wind blew.
A gentle, but strong wind.
It would not be unreasonable to call it an\n'encounter'.
What this could be the start of...
Even now, there's still no way for me to know.
The windmill is turning.
People are overwhelmed just because of the size\nof such enormous things.
This unnatural silhouette serves a purpose, but\nto those who don't know what that is, it would\nappear to be something very bizarre.
With so many lined up like this, it could be said\nto be even more overwhelming.
But why is that?
The sight of the white windmills lined up on the\ngreen hills, somehow seemed so picturesque.
'This is amazing... To think that something like\nthis could be made.'
At the very least, five years ago, there was\nnothing here, just a wide open space.
I heard they were going to build a large scale\nrenewable energy research facility...
The cell phone in my pocket vibrated to tell me I\nhad received a text.
'It's from An-chan...'
To Aoi. Did you arrive here already? Sorry I\ncouldn't come to meet you.
My name is written using a Chinese character read\nas 'Aoi'.
It's a difficult character and is often mistaken\nfor 'Midori'.
Incidentally, whether it is 'Aoi' or 'Midori', it\nis often mistaken for a girl's name, which causes\na few problems.
I'll quickly write a reply.
I hardly ever text, so I find the key-touch\nawkward to use.
I got here a little too early, so I'm just going\nfor a stroll. The windmills are amazing.
'OK, send.'
The reply came quickly.
They're great aren't they? It's the new famous\nspot of Kazegaura. If you have any problems,\ncontact me any time.
'An-chan...'
Thank you An-chan.
As I sent the text, I sat down on the grass.
This place is on the hillside, so from there I\nwas able to gaze at the lake and the town that\nstretches across the opposite bank.

The rapid redevelopment of the town of Kazegaura
meant that the remnants of the old buildings from
the Showa era are intermingled with the modern
architecture.
The view expresses both the past and the future\nat the same time.
Something white skimmed across my field of\nvision.
For a moment, it looked like one of the windmill\nblades had come flying off, but there's no way\nthat could happen.
'Is it a paper airplane?'
I got up and headed down the slope to look for\nit.
The paper airplane, gliding gently, eventually\nlost its momentum and descended.
'Gotcha!'
I ran ahead of it, did a small jump and caught it\nin midair.
'Where did this come flying from?'
Judging from the direction, it had come from the\ntop of the hill.
At a time and a place like this, could there be\nsomeone here besides me?
I took the paper airplane with me as I climbed up\nthe slope.
Just as I was about to be able to see the top,
A sudden gust of strong wind blew the paper\nairplane out of my hand.
'Ah! Hey, wait!'
I chased after the paper airplane and ran up the\nslope.
Then, just as I finally caught it...
There was someone on top of the hill.
It was a girl sitting in a wheelchair.
Looking fleetingly into the distant sky, a sudden\nbreeze blew her hair and she combed it back with\nher fingers.
Against the background of the blue sky and\nwindmills that spread across my view, the girl's\nblack hair and white blouse looked incredible.
It was as if I was looking at a completed work of\nart.
The girl noticed me.
'Ah, umm...'
At first, I thought I should make an excuse for\nwhy I was there.
It was like I had stepped into her world without\npermission, and I started to feel guilty.
She's not saying anything. Some guy had just\nsuddenly appeared, so perhaps she's being\ncautious.
To show her the reason why I had come here, I\nheld out the paper airplane.
'Did you throw this?'
The moment she saw it, her facial expression\nstiffened.
She looks like she's about to cry...
Suddenly, tears appeared in those delicate eyes.
'Huh? Whaaaat??'
The tears that had welled up in the corners of\nher eyes came running straight down.
'So, it got to you...'
As I watched, great big tears came rolling down\nher cheeks.
'Huh? Ah... hey!'
Without thinking, I walked up beside her.
'What's wrong? Do you hurt somewhere?'
'...(shakes head)'
As she shook her head, she touched the hand that\nI had unconsciously held out as if she were\nclinging to it.
Her hand was small and trembling.
'I was scared...'
Squeeze...
She gently squeezed my hand.
'It's OK now.'
I didn't even know what the situation was.
However, as I answered, I squeezed her hand back.
'Quack! Quack!'
Peck peck peck!
'Ow! Ouch!!'
Before I knew it, there was something like a\nchicken at my feet and all of a sudden, it\nstarted pecking me!
'Gah gah! Gwaah!!'
Peck peck peck!
'Ow, that hurts! What is this thing!?'
'Stop! Stop that, Hat!'
Hat, as it was called, calmed down at her\ncommand.
'Quack...'
'Umm... Is it a duck??'
With a yellow beak and white feathers, it was a\nduck that looked like a chicken.
For some reason, it was wearing a hat.
'...I'm sorry. It's because... I was crying.'
'It seems like he mistakenly thought that you\nmade me cry...'
So this is how surprising it is to be suddenly\nattacked by an animal.
However, thanks to that, it looked like she had\nstopped crying.
'Is a towel OK?'
'...I don't carry a handkerchief around with me.'
As I said that, without waiting for her to reply,\nI took a hand towel out of my bag. Of course, it\nhad been washed, so it was clean.
'Thank you...'
'Why were you crying? If it hurts somewhere...'
'That's not it.'
As she answered, she pointed to one of the wheels\nof her wheelchair.
It had lost its air and had collapsed.
'You got a flat tire?'
'...Because of that, I've been stuck here. I've\nbeen here for an hour already.'
What a terrible situation.
Just a mere flat tire, for her is like having her\nlegs taken away.
'Don't you have a cell phone?'
'...I left it in my room.'
She answered, dismayed.
'That's why I thought of another way to call for\nhelp.'
'That way, if there is someone who receives my\nSOS, they can come here for me...'
'SOS? Oh, this?'
I opened up the paper airplane that I still had\nin my hand.
'I'm in trouble, someone help me. I'm on Windmill\nHill.'
So when someone arrived carrying the paper\nairplane, she felt relieved and started to cry?
She was fine now but until just now, she was\nshaking. That must be how scared she was.
'Hold on a moment.'
The bag at my feet rustled as I rummaged around\ninside it.
When she saw the tools that I had taken out, she\nseemed confused.
'Would it be OK for you to get out for a moment?'
'I'm gonna fix it. You can't go anywhere if you\nhave a flat tire, can you?'
'W-Well yes but... Umm...'
'...Would you be able to give me a hand?'
Of course. Getting out of the wheelchair is not\neasy for her.
'Umm... what should I do?'
From the methods I'd seen on TV, the care workers\ndo it by embracing them from the front.
We both looked as though we'd imagined that\nsituation and froze.
'I... I think I'll do it myself.'
'Excuse me a moment.'
'Huh?'
'Eeeeek!!'
As I put my arms around her sides to her back, I\nsuddenly lifted her up.
'(Whoa, she's so light...!)'
Because she was much lighter than I had expected,\nthere was a bit too much momentum.
Before she could grasp the situation, I put her\ndown on the soft grass.
'...(Blushing)'
'I'll have it fixed soon, so hold on a moment.'
'Sure...'
'They're made in the same way as bicycle tires.'
I immediately started on the repairs.
She's behind me so I can't see her expression but\nI had a feeling I was being stared at with\ncontempt.
As I was quietly working, the duck was waddling\naround me and pecking at the soil.
'Is this duck your pet?'
'No, he isn't. We're housemates.'
Housemates...??
'I thought I'd go outside, and he started to\nfollow me.'
'Hat, don't go too far. You'll get left behind.'
'Quack...'
Do ducks recognize their own names? When he's\ncalled, he responds by turning around.
'Hey, he's pretty smart.'
'Yes he is. That's why he's so much trouble. He's\nalways getting into mischief.'
As I looked at the duck, I saw her legs laid out\non the grass in my field of vision.
'(So she can't move them?)'
There are a number of reasons why people need to\nuse a wheelchair but it looked like she had been\nwheelchair-bound for a while.
When I picked her up just now, her body stiffened\nup with surprise, but there was no strength at\nall in her legs.
The duck returned from his little excursion.
While walking around her, he would occasionally\ntry to jump onto her lap.
'Get off of me!'
She said as she made him get down again.
As I watched this exchange from the corner of my\neye, I fixed the flat tire.
'Boys are great aren't they? They always walk\naround with those kinds of tools...'
'That's not really the case though.'
I sometimes carry them with me.
'This is the first time I've sat on the grass in\nages. It's soft and feels nice.'
As she said that, she made a little 'Hnnnn' sound\nas she stretched.
'This is a nice place, isn't it?'
'Yeah, it is.'
'I can see it from my window. I wanted to come\nhere just once.'
'The wind blows through here.'
'Five years ago, there were no windmills though.'
'Five years ago?'
'I've just come back to this town.'
'Oh really...?'
She directed her gaze at something far away.
'So, you've come back to your hometown...'
'Yeah.'
She suddenly looked down and seemed lonely, and\nstrangely sad.
There was an awkward silence as I continued\nworking.
'Quack?'
The duck twisted its neck to look up at the sky.
'What is it, Hat?'
She was tempted to look up too.
'I wonder what that is?'
'What's that?'
'Something is flying.'
There was something floating in the air.
It was crossing the lake and gradually getting\ncloser.
At first, I thought that it was a paper airplane\nthat she had thrown coming back to us.
But it wasn't.
It crossed the lake and eventually reached the\nair above the small hill where we were.
'An airplane?'
It's not paper, it's a real plane.
But what is this? Its silhouette is much thinner\nthan any plane I know and the wings are really\nbig.
'It's a glider...'
'No doubt about it. That's a glider.'
'A glider?'
I repeated the name as if to confirm it, and then\nlooked to the sky once more.
With its big white wings and wide silhouette, it\nreminded me somewhat of a seagull.
'Hey, look, it's turning. It's so pretty...'
The glider (?) is continuing to turn leisurely\nabove our heads.
'It's flying ever so slowly.'
'Of course, it doesn't have any thrust.'
As it proceeded slowly across the blue sky, it\nseemed to be floating rather than flying.
'To fly on the wind like that...'
'It looks like it would feel nice.'
'Yeah...'
'It's coming down.'
The turning glider looks as if it had given up on\nrising, and came down towards the top of our\nhill.
I mean, it's not like it was coming down to land.
It was just reducing its altitude.
'Why don't we try waving? They might notice us.'
'Y, yeah...'
She earnestly stretched out her hand and waved\ntowards the white aircraft floating in the sky.
'Heeeeey!'
'Quack!'
I don't know if the pilot noticed us or not.
However, the wings reflected a gleaming light,\nand it really did look as if it was answering us\nfrom calling out to it.
Then, the glider turned its back to us and flew\naway, back to the other side of the lake, where\nit had come from.
'It's gone...'
She mumbled sadly as she lowered her hand.
I fixed the flat tire and went with her into the\ntown.
This is the residential area on the opposite bank\nof the lake to Windmill Hill, where we were just\nnow.
'Here is good enough.'
'I'll take you back to your home.'
'No, it's OK.'
It seemed like she was going to say 'but...'\nbefore she stopped speaking.

For a girl with a walking disability, just
because she was shown a little kindness, she
can't just bring some guy she hardly knows back
to her house.
'Thank you... Because of you, I was saved.'
'Don't mention it. If your tire ever goes flat\nagain, call me anytime.'
I only said it as a joke but she blushed and\nlooked down nervously.
'Quack...?'
'Ah, umm... Thank you.'
If you're thanking me, you already did that just\nnow.
'...It was quite fun. Like spending time with a\nfriend...'
'Yeah, me too. And I saw something unusual too.'
The glider that we had just seen was now flying\nin the air above the hill where we were just now.
'So did I. That's the first time I'd seen a real\none.'
'...I now have some wonderful memories.'
She murmured quietly and giggled.
Coupled with her cute and dainty appearance, was\nher lovely smile.
'Well then, I'd better get going.'
'OK, take care.'
'Sure.'
The wheels squeaked as she pushed the wheelchair\nalong with her hands, down an empty street.
Behind her, the duck wearing a hat waddled along\nwith her.
She stopped her hands and turned to face me.
'See you again!'
She looked troubled and embarrassed, then left\nwithout saying anything.
'...She sure was cute.'
Where is she from? Her appearance was quite\ngraceful as if she were the daughter of a rich\nfamily.
A little lady with a duck? It was an odd\ncombination but they seemed strangely familiar\nwith each other.
'OK, I'd better go.'
Now, I'm going to the dormitory called 'Flying\nFish Manor'.
Due to certain circumstances, that place will be\nmy new home.
While walking along the gently sloping street, I\nlook up at the clouds moving above.
Floating so freely like that, they reminded me of\nthe glider.
That distinctive silhouette had left a mysterious\nimpression on me.
'Huff, puff... I've finally found it.'
'This place... Is this it...?'
%LC%XS35 Flying Fish Manor
'There's such a big difference between its\nappearance and its name!'
That's like giving a tough-looking Japanese Tosa\na name like Lily!
At least call it 'Maison du Flying Fish' or\nsomething!
'Whew... That's why even though I looked\neverywhere I still couldn't find it.'
Because I thought 'It's not this place', I\ncompletely ruled it out, and then walked round\nand round this area...
Even now, I still can't believe it, so I'll check\nthe sign one more time.
'Flying Fish Manor... There's no doubt about it.\n...Even so, I'm still not entirely convinced.'
I mean, I know a lot about this place.

It's an old European-style building on the shore
of the lake, and because its appearance is a
little spooky, when we were kids, we called this
building the 'Witch's Mansion'.
As a test of courage, we would often sneak into\nthe yard.
We just thought it was a rich person's residence,\nbut it's a dormitory.
Keifuu Private Academy Student Dormitory.
'...I can't just stand here in shock.\nWhew...Haaaah...OK.'
I took a deep breath and stood up straight.
'May I come in?'
'Oh, a visitor?'
'Wooooaaaah!!?'
Suddenly a girl in her underwear appeared before\nme, and the expression that I had tried so hard\nto straighten out crumbled instantly.
'May I ask your name?'
'I, umm... ah...'
Why...?
She's the one who should be worried about having\nbeen seen but why I am the one feeling under\npressure...?
'We don't accept door-to-door sales.'
'What's up, Kana-chan?'
'Umm... looks like we have a visitor.'
'A visitor?...Huh? Whaaat!? A guy...!!?'
From inside, the other girl (this one was wearing\nclothes) showed her face but when she saw me, she\nlet out an hysteric scream.
At the same time, the glasses she was wearing\nlooked like they were about to slip off.
'Kana-chan, your clothes! Your clothes!!'
'Hmm?'
'What is it?'
Another girl appeared!
'Oh, Yuka! Th... this unknown boy just saw\nKana-chan's naked body!'
'What did you say!!?'
'Huh!? What? Huuuuh!!? No, no that's not it!!'
Just like receiving salvation from god, my cell\nphone rang.
The word 'Mom' was shown on the display.
'Excuse me a minute!!'
I quickly pressed the button to answer the call\nwhile swiftly escaping outside.
'Mom!'
'I thought you'd be at Flying Fish Manor and that\nthings would have calmed down by now. What's it\nlike?'
'Well, the place is full of girls!'
And I saw one in her underwear!
'? Of course it is. That place...'
'Yeah?'
I had checked the sign over and over but then I\nnoticed some small writing in the corner.
...Girl's Dormitory.
'This is a girl's dormitory!!!!!!'
'Oh, didn't I tell you...?'
'Did you do this on purpose!? What is this? What\nkind of mother are you!!?'
'From now on, I'm going to be this place's dorm\nmother, aren't I!!?'
'It's fine. The owner and the boarding students\nhave all accepted it.'
'Just now, they were screaming at the top of\ntheir lungs!'
'Oh, did you go into the changing room by\nmistake?'
'That damn mother of mine... She's enjoying this\nsituation.'
Creak...
The front door opened slightly and the girls from\njust now were peeking through.
'What's happening, Sana-chan?'
'He... he's still here...!'
When I called out to them, like a surprised\nturtle, they pulled their faces back inside and\nshut the door.
'...What should I do about this?'
'...Well, this is the situation.'
'Oh... So you're the new dorm mother?'

While I was explaining the situation, the
boarding students, apart from the girl in her
underwear (who was putting on some clothes)
surrounded me but kept their distance, and
watched me.
'This is no good is it...? A boy being the dorm\nmother of a girl's dormitory.'
'That's alright isn't it?'

From behind the underwear girl (she was wearing
clothes now but they were pretty gaudy) were some
girls who looked like they were hiding but they
were nodding and agreeing.
'If nobody comes here, that will be a bigger\nproblem.'
'Y...yes, that's right. But I just thought it\nwould be someone older...'
'Yeah...'
Incidentally, there is now one more person than\nbefore.
She was kind of timid and looked to be the same\nage, or maybe a year younger than me.
'(stare...)'
'Wha, what is it?'
'Did you say your name was Aoi? How old are you?'
'Umm... I'm still a student. From tomorrow, I'll\nbe going to Keifuu Academy.'
'I'm a second-year.'
'Heh, so you're in the grade below... Hee hee!'
Hee hee!' she said! Whadya mean 'Hee hee'!?
'The person who came to speak to all of you is my\nmother, and, well, she kind of half-tricked me\ninto accepting this job as dorm mother...'
My mom has a job connected to real estate and her\ncompany manages this property.
'Well then. What should we do, Yuka? Should we\nchange?'
'If that's the situation...'
The person who seemed the oldest said so, and the\nother people reluctantly nodded in agreement.
'This is just until the owner-caretaker comes\nback or we find someone else.'
'I apologize for the inconvenience but for the\ntime being, let's all try to get along.'
Once the conversation was over, naturally,\neveryone left and went back to their rooms.
'Hey, I'm sorry. Everyone can be so childish and\nthey got carried away in front of a young guy\nlike you.'
'Ummm...'
'I'm Kanako Shigure. If you need anything, please\nask me.'
'The caretaker's room is at the end of the\ncorridor on the first floor.'
'Thank you very much.'
'Was that all of the boarding students?'
There's the underwear girl, Kanako, who is with\nme now.
Yuka, the tall girl with the long hair and Sana,\nthe girl with the glasses. The timid one who came\nfrom the back is Ryouko.
That's four people altogether.
'Ah, well there is one more person but she's what\nyou might call the reclusive type...'
'I wonder if she'll come out of her room at some\npoint?'
'Oh.'
In other words, there are five boarders in total.
This building is pretty big but there are only\nfive people living here.

Come to think of it, my mom did say that there
are quite a few empty rooms. It's old and a
little far from the school, so maybe it's not
that popular.
'Whew... I've worked up a sweat so I'm gonna take\nanother bath.'
Anyway, the conversation ended well, so I'll call\nmy mother to let her know.
'...so, in the end, we somehow worked things\nout.'
'Really, that's good. I'll tell you this now\nthough, keep your hands off the girls!'
'Wha, what are you talking about, Mom!!?'
'Well, as long as it doesn't cause any problems,\nit's OK. Oh and also...'
'I told you before, but one of them has a walking\ndisability.'
Flap flap flap!!
Suddenly, the sound of flapping wings came from\ndown the hallway.
Then, a shrill voice sounded out.
'Wait, Hat!'
'Quack! Quaaaaaaack!!!'
Something big and white came flying down the\nhallway, and behind it, at breakneck speed...
...was the girl in the wheelchair.
'Wait, you stupid duck!! Give my panties\nback...!!'
'Quack, Quack! Quaaaaaack!!'
The big white thing... which somehow seemed like\na duck, was flapping its wings and flew behind\nme.
The girl in the wheelchair avoided all the\nobstacles in her path, in other words, me, and\nchased down the duck like a drift racer.
I was so overwhelmed by the speed that I couldn't\nsay anything.
'I've got you, Hat!'
'Quack, quack!'
The girl in the wheelchair caught the duck at my\nfeet, and snatched away a small, white cloth\n(possibly panties) from his beak.
'Jeez, you're always playing tricks! If you do it\nagain, I'll turn you into Peking Duck!'
'Quack...'
The girl put the duck on her knee and lectured\nhim.
I remembered seeing that before.
However,
'(...It's somehow a lot different compared to the\nimage she had during the day!)'
In the daytime, she seemed more dainty and\ndelicate.
However, her appearance was the same. It's not\noften that you see such a pretty girl.
'Looks like your tire is in good condition!'
She finally realized that there was a guy\nstanding there.
'Hello, Aoi, are you listening?'
'Ahh, yeah. What was it?'
'I was saying there's a disabled girl, so take\ngood care of her.'
'Sure, I got it. Ok, talk to you soon mom.'
I replied as I ended the call.
'Why are you...?'

She got as far as saying that but then realized
that she has the small cloth in her hand, and
tried to hide it by stuffing it under her
backside.
'...why are you here?'
'He's the new dorm mother, Kotori-chan.'
Kanako, who was supposed to be taking a bath,\npoked her head out.
'Really? What do you mean? I hadn't heard about\nthat!!'
'Even if I tried to tell you, Kotori-chan, you\nhardly ever come out of your room!'
'You mean the new dorm mother, is a boy!!!?'
Hey, look! Hey, look!
is what it felt like she was saying as she\nrelentlessly pointed at me.
'We already had this conversation a long time\nago.'
The girl known as Kotori, glared at Kanako like\nshe was interfering.
'I'm the new dorm mother, Aoi Minase.'
'I'm Kotori Habane.'
Kotori seemed to meet my introduction with\nreluctance.
'Quack!'
'This is Hat. But you know that already.'
'Quaaack!'
Hat turned to face me and flapped his wings. He's\na clever duck.
'Are you really the new dorm mother...?'
'Yes, that's right. So you... are against it?'

If she says she doesn't like the fact the dorm
mother of a girl's dormitory is a guy, or the
fact that we're the same age, there's nothing I
can do about it.
Kotori closes her eyes, and quietly takes a deep\nbreath as if trying to focus her mind.
'Kotori?'
'Forget about what happened during the day.'
'During the day? Which part?'
'As much as possible... That's right, if I had to\nsay...'
She stopped talking and stared at Kanako, who was\nstanding behind listening.
Kanako looked as if she was saying 'OK, OK' as\nshe disappeared down the hallway.
'That I made a careless mistake, and that I\nstarted crying!!'
That incident was quite startling and I remember\nit well.
To see a girl's tears from so close like that is\nsomething I don't experience very often.
I don't know what she thinks about it but those\ntears were very beautiful.
'Have you forgotten it?'
'Huh? No, not yet.'
'Forget about it! Right now!!'
'Don't be so silly!'
When you say it like that, it just becomes more\nstrongly engraved in my memory.
'Sniff...'
'Look, you're new here, so you don't know. Even\nlike this, I...'
Kotori straightened her back,
composed her expression and smiled,
and 'swish', with a natural gesture, she lifted\nher hair up.
'Don't you feel my cool 'allule'?'
'What's 'allule'?'
'Ah, allure! I just said it a bit wrong, that's\nall!'
'Oh... I've heard that word before.'
'I'll say it again! Let me do it again!!'
She said that and then straightened her back and\nmade a composed smile again.
'OK, that's enough! I get it, all right?'
'Grrrr...'
'Geez! You're such a jerk! Nitpicker! Lowlife!'
Kotori used just about every insult there is,\nthen turned her wheelchair around.
Then, she hurriedly raced back down the hallway\nand back into her room.
'Quack!!'

Along the way, Hat, who had been thrown off,
chased after her and entered the room through a
small door (maybe a special door for ducks) built
into the bottom of the main door.
I looked on in disbelief.
I don't need to say this but the dainty and\ndelicate image that she had in the daytime had\ncompletely crumbled away.
A delicate bud was beginning to sprout, and we\nshared a fleeting love.
But...
'Cool 'allule'...right?'
When I remember her lifting her hair and being so\nfull of confidence, I feel like I could burst out\nlaughing.
'She's so funny.'
From the beginning, everything has been so messed\nup.
